website_summaries.verdict: Gives a higher-end, wood-style look in a closed design that restricts pest access to your feet.
pros: Attractive, two-tone finish that complements your tub wall
Easy to care for, with little maintenance
cons: Not as sturdy as others from this brand

customer_reviews.title: B for Butthurt
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why this is so highly reviewed. 'Twas a heck of a time getting the cheapy notch mechanism to a. Line up and b. Hold. While wielding the mallet my husband declared war on at least two countries and my neighbor's chickens packed their travel totes. Two stars only because once somewhat-assembled it feels pretty sturdy. Ours is positioned at eye level and we get the side-view...about as attractive as Steve Buscemi in a hailstorm.
customer_reviews.author: Raini

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive option but somewhat cheesy looking
customer_reviews.text: This is s decent inexpensive stair option. They snap together like Little Tykes kids equipment. Make sure to use in solid surface because they are super light and easily tip. Also I’d say if you have heavier folks using (my hubby and I are both pretty light), this would not be a good option.
customer_reviews.author: Jolene Church

customer_reviews.title: RE: @Pragmatic post on modifying for storage
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to @Pragmatic, who wrote how to modify these for storage. In addition, my steps had 2 pilot holes/hinge side, though I got 3-hole hinges, requiring 12 screws, plus I bought 4 extra screws, 2 for the 7” 2nd step support, & 2 spares. Since the 3-hole hinge doesn’t align with the 2-hole pilots, I angled the outer screws inward. The extra screws in the middle should add extra support. In hindsight, I would rather have the low-profile countersink tapered screwheads, instead of panheads pictured, since the latter makes the top step not quite snug when closed.
customer_reviews.author: OCD

customer_reviews.title: Cannot put together!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have spent many hours putting together ikea furniture but nothing has prepared me for the frustration of trying to put this useless box of heavy duty plastic together. Nothing fits right although they say just tap it into locking position. They don’t lock. Noting aligns properly which is a shame because I think it would be a useful set of stairs if it went together. Always be wary when the instructions state you need a drill, a rubber mallet and a friend. With all three I still cannot get this together. Don’t waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Lisalu

customer_reviews.title: Hard to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Had hard time assembling. Mainly bottom step as you have to put downward pressure on step while pounding it into slot in order to get it lined up with tab that it snaps onto. My tab bent in. Had to really work to get it usable. The steps are bit spongy when you step on them (I weigh 200lbs). The write up says no hardware yet there are 4 screws and you have to drill 4 holes for those screws then screw them in....isn’t that hardware? Other than that I like the steps
customer_reviews.author: Bronda

customer_reviews.title: Great for platform storage bed!
customer_reviews.text: Took some time to put together, once I accomplished that feat, it was perfect! It didn’t come with a rubber mallet which was little disappointing, so I got creative and wrapped a rubber mat around a hammer, it did the trick! Pack your patience putting it together! Didn’t need the screws that came with it since it was only the steps without the storage!
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Great Steps!
customer_reviews.text: We bought a set of these stairs about four years ago to use on a patio and they have been great! Because they have held up and are weather resistant we purchased this set to use outside for a shed we have. The wooden steps originally to the shed had fallen apart. These have replaced them perfectly. Would recommend these stairs to any one.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Very nice steps!
customer_reviews.text: These are really nice steps! I just got mine today (10/22/19). The only thing tricky in assembling is when you install the first (lower) step tread. The rear edge of the step tread needs to go down into a lock groove that’s at the bottom of the upright piece at the back edge and then it needs to be hammered down onto two locking tabs one on each vertical side, at the same time. I’m 6’6”, 300lbs and these didn’t even move one bit when I stepped on them! I was really surprised! I highly recommend getting the non slip, self adhesive strips to put on each step! I can easily see they would be slippery when wet!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great purchase
customer_reviews.text: We were happy to see how easy to assemble these stairs were. They are much sturdier than expected and are actually better quality than the steps given to us at the original purchase of our spa. The stairs are also relatively attractive and match our spa perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Pete K

customer_reviews.title: Could have been a better design for assembly
customer_reviews.text: Could have been a better design for assembly! Even with a mallot (rubber, of course), it was a pain, to get this thing connected...which was disappointing quite frankly. Time will tell as to how durable it is...the jury's still out on that fact.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than wood steps. Good color and simple style.
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace wooden steps from 2 bathrooms to outside. Last steps rotted and were unsafe. These are sturdy and not hard to assemble if you have a helper. They don’t require additional screws or any other hardware. But know you need a rubber mallet.
customer_reviews.author: Frank E C

customer_reviews.title: Unable to put together
customer_reviews.text: This looks like a really nice but was unable to get it to "snap" together. I tried for over an hour every time I would get one side in and then other side would pop out. Ended up sending it back. Too bad, was hoping it would solve my step issue.
customer_reviews.author: irelandfamily

customer_reviews.title: Beware! - Gets extremely hot in the sun!  Will potentially burn your feet or your pet's paws!
customer_reviews.text: I have had these steps for about a year now. They work great and are very sturdy. No issues with them moving from where they were placed. I was surprised and disappointed to find out that the steps get extremely hot when sitting in the sun. I assumed that since they were a light gray color, they wouldn't get that hot, but I was wrong. My small dogs like to sit on the top step by our patio door when they are ready to come in. Because the stair will potentially burn their feet, I put a narrow stair tread on each step to protect them. Other than that issue, I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for wood steps.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, looks great. Use this to replace rotted wood steps from deck onto concrete slap. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Richard T. Callahan

customer_reviews.title: Grest
customer_reviews.text: Using on back porch for people and dog/puppy steps. In buffalo. Cold ice and snow. Anti ice pellets not bothering the plastic. Direct wind and low wind chill its been in the teens temp wise No problems w assembly
customer_reviews.author: Sandra S.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This set of stairs was so easy to put together. It was really sturdy and heavy and constructed very well. It looks great in my lanai where there's a big step down from the house to the concrete floor
customer_reviews.author: Lacy

customer_reviews.title: Extremely sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised at how nice these are. Easy to put together
customer_reviews.author: Lea Ann Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Also beware - the steps are very slick for certain flat bottom shoes like flip-flops. I plan to add some traction strips
customer_reviews.text: Simple to put together and attractive for the price. I didn't trust the "snap together" construction and added screws to everything, including the steps. I also staked them to the ground. I would not consider these safe without taking such steps. Also beware - the steps are very slick for certain flat bottom shoes like flip-flops. I plan to add some traction strips.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Superior Design and Engineering
customer_reviews.text: Design, manufacture and function are excellent. A concrete garage floor or sidewalk provide the best surface for assembly. We use these steps for access to a large storage shed. Made in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: Casden

customer_reviews.title: Perfect match to our hot tub!
customer_reviews.text: We bought a new hot tub from Amazon for about 1/2 price and needed steps. This matches the hot tub perfect and makes it easy to get in and out. Great value
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Handy

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Wonder
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a plastic wonder. But structurally solid. Recommend what others have said, invest in a couple of more screws. Very pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Broffermoon

customer_reviews.title: If you have a rubber mallet this is pretty easy to get together
customer_reviews.text: If you have a rubber mallet this is pretty easy to get together, I'm not sure it is worth $100 but it worked perfect for us. It is fairly sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Attractive, sturdy, and kind of a pain to put together
customer_reviews.text: A bit expensive and a bit of a pain to put together. Rubber mallet is a must. Luckily, you only have to build it once. Judging by materials and build it should last for a long time. I’m not using it as spa stairs but it will be exposed to the elements so if anything goes wrong I’ll update. P.S. I think it looks great!
customer_reviews.author: Frank Kirwin

customer_reviews.title: Buy a rubber mallet.  Very sturdy steps!
customer_reviews.text: These are sturdy and work great to get off my back porch. I had a little trouble putting them together, definitely need a rubber mallet but with that, the assembly is easy.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly A. Edgin

customer_reviews.title: I've never dealt with a more accommodating company.
customer_reviews.text: Their design is very substantial and safe. Well thought out and molded from very strong plastic "blow molds". One of the few products I have found that I consider worth far more than the charge. In addition, I wanted the steps to be arranged side by side (for clearance limitations out from the Hot Tub). (Not a super safe arrangement; you have to realize that they are not "in line" as you exit the Hot Tub). These folks worked with me to achieve this new design and sent me several add-on pieces with no additional cost.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Claffy

customer_reviews.title: Great steps for hot tub
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time, easy to put together. Matches very good with hot tub. Perfect height, width and length on these steps for easy and safe
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Rose

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and lightweight to add steps to an elevated storage unit and not spa as intended. Exchange policy was easy and seamless customer service was responsive
customer_reviews.author: trujillo francisco

customer_reviews.title: We received this product on time and It was easy to put together and seems to serve it's purpose
customer_reviews.text: I just wrote a review where I said I was still waiting for this product and only gave it one star. I'm sorry I was reviewing something else by mistake. We received this product on time and It was easy to put together and seems to serve it's purpose.
customer_reviews.author: S. W.

customer_reviews.title: Nice lightweight steps
customer_reviews.text: We use these steps to get in and out of our camper as the metal step connected to our camper didn’t work well for our little dog. Lightweight, easy to move in and out of the camper when traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Hartley

customer_reviews.title: Super Fantastic Customer Service from vendor
customer_reviews.text: I had a bit of difficulty assembling and I contacted the seller and he provided a You Tube video to support the written instructions. When I asked for him to consider sending me an assembled version. He immediately agreed and sent it out immediately. Service was Amazing
customer_reviews.author: Keith Green

customer_reviews.title: A worthwhile investment
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 36" model. Once Amazon finally shipped it some 5 or 6 days after purchasing it, I was glad to open the box and put it together. I had no problems with assembly. I folowed the instruction and did not even need a hammer. I am not trying to say that some should not have and possibly did something wrong. Only that I had no problems. Maybe there was a slight change in manufacturing of the steps. The steps are very sturdy and are a welcome to the hot tub pleasure. Getting rid of the old wood steps was a need that could wait no longer. I recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: MrLittlejohn

customer_reviews.title: Tip for Assembly
customer_reviews.text: I added screws for the 7" vertical piece between the step treads, and, installed them the same way as the other 2 vertical supports, as noted in the instructions. This enabled me to assemble the rest of the unit without an assistant.
customer_reviews.author: laudtod

customer_reviews.title: No storage-but otherwise durable
customer_reviews.text: The only thing it needs is a storage spot. I don't understand why that could not have been accomplished. Waste of valuable space. Durable and weather resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: We bought this step for our patio to get into our house. It’s fairly solid. It does the job and looks ok. Probably not worth the $100 I paid for it though.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Gillingham

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent grade of plastic. Very sturdy and stable. Steps are used in the garage and easily hold my 200 lbs frame without buckling, sagging or sliding around. Regardless of other reviews my assembly was easy and quick. Did not require extra screws and pieces fit together easily. Do need a rubber mallet as stated. Highly impressed. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: EbonyMoon

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this.  Bottom step does not fit securely
customer_reviews.text: The bottom step does not fit no matter what we tried and slides off. Useless and a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Arcticwynd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My wooden hot tub stairs rotted out. You can't beat these for the money and they are not slippery when you get out which was my only concern.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Steps
customer_reviews.text: Loved these! I got them for my father to make it easier for him to get in and out of the hot tub. They were perfect for him.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is too large for my spa
customer_reviews.text: I like it but not for my spa. It is over kill
customer_reviews.author: Sherrilum

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a good deal. The steps are not fancy but they are sturdy. My dad is over 200lbs and uses the step just fine. The instructions for assembly were a bit confusing however we did well figuring it out on our own! I would recommend this to anyone especially if you are looking for something functional for a low price.
customer_reviews.author: Kamilah T.

customer_reviews.title: Great step but assembly isn't all that easy.
customer_reviews.text: We are using this step to go from the garage to the house. It is the perfect height and we are very pleased with it. However, assembly was much more difficult than the directions lead you to believe. Once assembled we are very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: N. Tellier

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We watched youtube videos to see how to do this. It was that easy!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Porter

customer_reviews.title: Wrong color
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the redwood and beige and received redwood and black . Funny thing is that wasn't even a option . So we put in a 2nd order let's see what we get the 2nd time around !! Other than that they look like they could be nice .
customer_reviews.author: Mike P.

customer_reviews.title: Need tools!
customer_reviews.text: Need drill and mallet. Not too hard to assemble. Looks good
customer_reviews.author: EdlynR

customer_reviews.title: Great Steps
customer_reviews.text: These Spa Steps are the best thing I have bought in a long time. I had wooden steps previously and had to keep recoating them each year and then finally they rotted away. These steps were very easy to put together following the enclosed instructions. I was able to have them together within 15 minutes after receiving them. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Not worth $129 at all!
customer_reviews.text: This came in a box that was beat up pretty bad. Lots of dings and scratches on the plastic. The plastic is super lightweight and I'm concerned about it lasting more than a year. It's an OK stairs, but I didn;t feel I should have paid $129 for it. Maybe half that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Attractive Looking Steps
customer_reviews.text: We bought these steps to match our silver grey hot tub. It looks great, sturdy non slip steps. You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Patti B.

customer_reviews.title: Spa Stairs
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these steps for our new shed and really like them. They work just perfect for what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: TMK

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: The steps look good, and are very easy to assemble. However, I was under the impression that this was a fully enclosed set of steps, like the storage steps made by the same company (just without the storage capabilities). They are actually open on the bottom and back. My current set of steps are open and spiders are abundant, so I am looking to eliminate that problem. I am returning these steps and exchanging them for the storage steps by Leisure Accents, as they are only $15 more and from what I can tell, they are fully enclosed.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Carter

customer_reviews.title: So far this has worked out great for us
customer_reviews.text: So far this has worked out great for us. We have an enclosed spa room. Both my husband and I are within normal weight ranges, but I am a little uncomfortable having both of us stand on the same step.
customer_reviews.author: Vonda

customer_reviews.title: I use our maybe 1 time every two weeks so these are going to be just fine.
customer_reviews.text: These work. They are OK. They will do the job. However, they are somewhat flimsy. If you use your hot tub every day and have a lot of people in it, these probably are NOT what you need. I use our maybe 1 time every two weeks so these are going to be just fine.
customer_reviews.author: adamBomb

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, easy to assemble. Half of the price that my local dealer wanted, and just as good as their model.
customer_reviews.author: Strickd

customer_reviews.title: I love my new steps
customer_reviews.text: I love my new steps! Putting together was a little bit of a challenge as one part would pop out when I tried to hammer in the other side. But it didn't take long before I had myself a nice set of LIGHTWEIGHT reliable steps!
customer_reviews.author: Jezebel L

customer_reviews.title: Nice step
customer_reviews.text: It is a step that does what it is supposed to do, provide easier access to a hot tub. It is sturdy and stable, not slippery when it’s wet.
customer_reviews.author: K-dub

customer_reviews.title: This was used for a side porch step-down into the ...
customer_reviews.text: This was used for a side porch step-down into the small garden area for a while. Then we used it as a step down from the deck for our 3 cats.
customer_reviews.author: Yor1lady

customer_reviews.title: A Solid Easy 1 2 3 Solution
customer_reviews.text: This two stepper was actually a replacement to an old, rickety, wood step that took our traffic from the patio and spa area just outside our slide glass door to the inside of our house. The stairs were easily put together in front of the television while I watched a 30 minute television show. The larger width was just what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: David D Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great Spa Steps!
customer_reviews.text: These steps are a great addition to our patio hot tub. They arrived promptly and my wife and I had them assembled in just a few minutes with a rubber mallet and a Phillips screwdriver. The color is right on, they look great up against our tub and provide easy access in and out of the water. I am 6' 3" tall and weigh 300lbs so I needed some sturdy steps and these can easily support my weight.
customer_reviews.author: D. Emigh

customer_reviews.title: use the rubber hammer and put the steps away in ...
customer_reviews.text: use the rubber hammer and put the steps away in winter to preserve the plastic. reasonable product but wish it had a back on it
customer_reviews.author: mmm

customer_reviews.title: The price was reasonable.
customer_reviews.text: We used the steps for our hot tub. They were perfect
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Impossible to assemble! Plastic nubs would not seat under their counterparts, no matter how much we hit with a rubber mallet. Nothing lined up well and it’s a rickety mess.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery and assembly. It works perfectly for entry stairs into house from garage!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Thornburg

customer_reviews.title: Great for Hot Tub
customer_reviews.text: Really like these steps that make it easy to get in & out of our hot tub . . . especially the length that matches the side dimension of out tub. Very sturdy and non-slick. The gray color of ours also compliments wood panel siding.
customer_reviews.author: G. A. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Nice stairs ..we bought two!!
customer_reviews.text: We like these. Relatively easy to put together and hold up to heavy weight well...
customer_reviews.author: David Berry

customer_reviews.title: The steps seem fine, but...
customer_reviews.text: Assembly required some trimming of parts that shouldn't need trimming. Plus, I never heard back from customer service after calling and leaving a message concerning the apparent mismatch of parts. Once assembled, they seem fine and sturdy. I weigh 175 lbs and have no concern using these--absolutely no flexing in the middle, etc. I would have rated the product higher--maybe even 5 stars--had the assembly been less complicated and customer service been responsive. For a few more bucks, I'd go with their other steps with a storage compartment. Search on "Leisure Accents Spa Step with Storage Compartment".
customer_reviews.author: JettaRed

customer_reviews.title: Having solid and wide steps for our trailer was crucial ...
customer_reviews.text: Having solid and wide steps for our trailer was crucial to me since I have knee issues. This one really does the trick. It does not collapse and it is large, but we just throw it in the trailer last.
customer_reviews.author: kathy kampman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect steps for hot tub. Liked so much bought another set
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: functional but poorly constructed
customer_reviews.text: The step is functional but poorly constructed. The snap-together pieces do not hold well and now that the step is in place, we are very careful with moving it to sweep around it or clean it for fear that it will fall apart. The item came with an extra sheet of instructions and screws. Apparently, we were not the only customers to have this problem. We have not installed the screws because there is no way to ensure that they will stay in place and not just pull thru the plastic, leaving holes and jagged pieces when they inevitably fall out. It was highly over priced for the poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Phone-Case-Fail

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: These steps are so perfect for the side of our Front porch. We can easily lift them up to pull Our camper out of the driveway. The steps are very sturdy and solid for us older folks.
customer_reviews.author: lon eliason  & Robin Riley

customer_reviews.title: but I'd recommend an alternative
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy with this step. The pieces don['t fit together well and I spent hours trying to make it work. It's hopefully going to hold together, but I'd recommend an alternative. Gr4eat idea, but poor execution.
customer_reviews.author: guru b

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for our hot tub. Works great and just the right size.
customer_reviews.author: Blmorgan

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my daughters hot tub, she loves how long it is
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lost cost and good looking solution.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the failing wooden steps to my observatory. It was easy to assemble when you take the time to trim the flash off the plastic parts.
customer_reviews.author: Starman27

customer_reviews.title: Nice steps
customer_reviews.text: Works great. You must anchor them or they can slip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great steps
customer_reviews.text: great steps, a little bit hard to assemble but great and sturdy steps
customer_reviews.author: ernest

customer_reviews.title: Great in the end
customer_reviews.text: After assembly is done it’s well worth it. Sturdy, nice looking and good price. Assembly not the easiest but it ends up coming together.
customer_reviews.author: CDVANDERBILT

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THESE! The quality is atrocious for the price. Setup is awful.. Manufacturing is not there. Avoid the headache and inevitable return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy assembly, nice size
customer_reviews.text: easy assembly, nice size, but it does get really hot if it sits in the sun, mine sits the sun and it does get really hot if your feet or not wet, but we use a foot pan to clean feet off before entering spa, as all spa owners should have.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't assemble without tools.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have access to a cordless drill. Had to wait until my son came over to assemble the steps.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Singley

customer_reviews.title: "Good stuff"
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised at the detailed engineering so that all parts fit each other perfectly. I HATE "cheap crap" and this "ain't it"....it IS "good stuff"!
customer_reviews.author: DOUGLAS D DURBIN

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use compact and light
customer_reviews.text: fit my needs perfectly as a replacement for a small redwood deck/stairs to take up less space and be less slippery in the winter. The directions for assembly were terrible. Common sense will get you through if you go slowly and carefully. Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Siemens

customer_reviews.title: Try something else
customer_reviews.text: Incomprehensible instructions, frustrating to assemble, pieces don't fit together well, top step doesn't secure, seems tippy if you stepped on the edge. Base color is lighter than pictured, doesn't match hottub, top steps were redwood as pictured. On the plus side, I needed a step that i didn't have to keep painting like my wood one and the size is right.
customer_reviews.author: bonnie in denver

customer_reviews.title: Not a complete order
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping this would work. Received the package and many parts where missing. Not A HAppy Camper
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Steps assembled very quickly and easily and are very sturdy. Our spa entry is concave and although the steps don't fit flush, I have no problem reaching the step or trusting their durability like I used to with our wood steps.
customer_reviews.author: Marcie

customer_reviews.title: but sturdy product.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered grey/beige, but its more grey/black - not even close to colors stated. but sturdy product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: did not fit
customer_reviews.text: When the pieces arrived they did not fit together,not matter how much you hammered on them. I tryed soap wd40 u name it. The directions were simple enough but they would just not fit together. But there is a good ending I emailed the company and explained and after a cpl emails,I was told they were going to send out the spa step completely put together. They arrived and were complete just as they said they would be. Thank you for putting up with me and standing behind your product,oh and they look great. Yes i would tell anyone to buy these steps......G
customer_reviews.author: GMan

customer_reviews.title: Need tools to assemble
customer_reviews.text: The assembly was difficult based on the representation on the listing
customer_reviews.author: Tom Craven

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: happy i had a neighbor to put this together for me not as easy as claimed
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen  Gallo

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: These are actually really cool steps. I painted and aged them and they looked awesome. Was not hard to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Aprile B.

customer_reviews.title: perfect size for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I bought these steps to use for my new deck, not for a spa. It fits perfectly for my needs. Easy to assemble. Steps a little 'spongy' but feel secure and steady.
customer_reviews.author: reb

customer_reviews.title: Timely receipt of the product.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy assembly. Lightweight to carry but could use a little more heft in the construction for better stability for this big guy.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Szabo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love these steps. Perfect for my hot tub. Easy to assemble. Sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Kandie Fabian

customer_reviews.title: My review might be a little off. I don't ...
customer_reviews.text: My review might be a little off. I don't know how to be opening it for storage because it's very tightly closed. Has anyone else had that problem?
customer_reviews.author: Oleg

customer_reviews.title: Like the steps
customer_reviews.text: I Use the step ever night for my hot tub it is very sturdy and seem well built .i thought it might be slippery but it not
customer_reviews.author: grahame  rae

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Nice and wide. Non slip. Should hold a good amount of weight. At 170 there's no flex at all.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Stocker

customer_reviews.title: worked great
customer_reviews.text: needed for porch steps after not being able to find any local. worked great and very sturdy. very happy with purchase
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Very nice spa steps!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these steps! Easy to snap together, used the drill to put the few screws in, and wala! Beautiful and functional!
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Leisure Accents Deluxe Spa Step REVEIW
customer_reviews.text: What a great product...simple to assemble ...heavy duty and a great value . I couldn't be more happy. NO MORE NUT-CRUNCHERS GETTING OUT OF THE HOT-TUB...WOOT !
customer_reviews.author: Aj

customer_reviews.title: Best steps on the market
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the new hot tub steps.. Been looking for a year locally. I am so glad I checked out Amazon.com and found these steps.

customer_reviews.title: perfect!
customer_reviews.text: So easy and quick to put together. We love it! Matches redwood tub exactly

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Plastic
customer_reviews.text: PLASTIC IS CHEAP. Doesn't fit together nice at all. Wouldn't buy again if I had a choice. Don't know how long it will stay together.
